explanation:
code_hardening: Initialized the shared allTransmitters list inside the method, ensured each MIDI device is opened before accessing transmitters, and guarded against null or empty transmitter lists when iterating.
resolve_compilation_errors: Introduced a properly declared protected initDevices() method matching the constructor call, used existing project types (ArrayList, MidiSystem, MidiDevice, Transmitter), and relied on already-present imports.
exception_handling: Retained silent handling of MidiUnavailableException with per-device try/catch so one failing device does not interrupt initialization of others.
logic_customization: Changed the flow to open each device before querying transmitters, set receivers only on transmitters returned by getTransmitters(), and stored the deviceâ€™s default transmitter in the shared list without assigning a receiver.
refactoring: Moved constructor logic into initDevices for clearer lifecycle control, grouped per-device initialization steps, and standardized the output message casing to "was opened".
misc: Applied minor formatting consistency and minimal logging via System.out.println; no new custom API calls were introduced.
